abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Rural Water and
            Sanitation Project for Haiti were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, risk to development outcomes were moderate,
            Bank performance was satisfactory, and Borrower performance
            was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: rural
            communities are willing to accept a new management model
            using a professional operator model and payment for water
            based on volume consumed. The maintenance responsibilities
            for institutional latrines should be agreed upon before
            construction begins. A better mechanism for source
            protection needs to be developed. Finding the right match
            for South-South knowledge exchanges improved the
            operators' commitment and confidence in the new
            profession. Engaging in sector transformation with a
            long-term programmatic approach has a lasting impact.
            Development objectives and intermediate results for
            different funding to the same project need to be harmonized.
